headline: UPS Ordered to Pay $45 Million for Overvaluing Freight Business
summary: The Securities and Exchange Commission said UPS didn’t properly record goodwill impairment related to its freight business, which was sold in 2021, because it had overvalued the unit.

raw.headline: UPS Ordered to Pay $45 Million for Overvaluing Freight Business
raw.summary: The Securities and Exchange Commission said UPS didn’t properly record goodwill impairment related to its freight business, which was sold in 2021, because it had overvalued the unit.

headline: MicroStrategy, UPS, Honeywell: 3 trending headlines
summary: Citron Research shorts MicroStrategy (MSTR), which is considered to be a bitcoin (BTC-USD) proxy, citing the stock is untethered from the cryptocurrency's fundamentals. UPS (UPS) will pay $45 million to the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) for failing to use generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP) when evaluating its freight segment, which the SEC said misrepresented the value of the business. Honeywell (HON) will sell its personal protective equipment (PPE) business for $1.33 billion amid ongoing pressures from activist investors. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Wealth here. This post was written by Naomi Buchanan.

headline: UPS to Pay $45 Million SEC Penalty Over Improper Valuation

headline: UPS to pay $45 million penalty for improperly valuing business unit, SEC says
summary: The United Parcel Service (UPS) will pay up to a $45 million penalty for improperly valuing a business unit, the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) said on Friday.

raw.headline: UPS to pay $45 million penalty for improperly valuing business unit, SEC says
raw.summary: The United Parcel Service (UPS) will pay up to a $45 million penalty for improperly valuing a business unit, the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) said on Friday.
